definition: to change/to become different/to transform/to vary/rebellion
to make into/to change into/-ization/to ... -ize/to transform/abbr. for 化學|化学[hua4 xue2]

sentences.english: The concentration of treacherous black holes made accidental discovery of the base an impossibility.
sentences.chinese: 变化莫测的黑洞群使基地几乎不可能被意外发现。

sentences.english: It is a quicksilver business and wildly lucrative.
sentences.chinese: 这是一门变化莫测，收益极其丰厚的生意。

sentences.english: The luxury-goods business is'absolutely flying blind, ' he says.
sentences.chinese: 他说，奢侈品行业绝对是变化莫测的。

sentences.english: The world is whizzing by and your head's spinning.
sentences.chinese: 这个世界是变化莫测，你的脑袋也得跟着转得快点。

sentences.english: He had forgotten how iolent and unpredictable these human mortals could be.
sentences.chinese: 而他都忘了这些人类是多么残暴而变化莫测。

sentences.english: Signal attenuation in the power line environment is often great, and unpredictable.
sentences.chinese: 信号衰减在输电线环境经常是伟大和变化莫测的。

sentences.english: Viewed from Wall Street, the administration’s recent actions appear erratic enough.
sentences.chinese: 在华尔街看来，政府最近的行为是如此地变化莫测。

sentences.english: Ssangyong's history with strategic investors is checkered.
sentences.chinese: 双龙此前与战略投资者的历史也变化莫测。

definition: in an instant a myriad changes (idiom); rapid substantial change
to drift without a resting place (idiom)/roving/errant/vagrant/erratic
hard to tell if it's real or sham
variable/changeable/fickle/impermanence (Sanskrit: anitya)/ghost taking away the soul after death/to pass away/to die
brilliant and varied/(often in the combination 精彩纷呈)
to fathom/to make sense of/to grasp
